txt.en:
'My brother and I come from across the river. We're preparing to hunt a simply grand beast. Have you heard of the Mûmakil? They are giant, tusked creatures from lands south of here.'

You ask Derufin about Anborn.

'You can try talking to Anborn but I don't know how far you'll get. He admires our skill with the bow, but it ends there. You may have better luck with Thurindol. That Thurindol is a pleasant fellow, wouldn't you agree, Duilin?'
Derufin and Duilin can be found in Bâr Húrin.\n\nYou should speak with Derufin and Duilin.
Anborn and Thurindol can be found inside the keep at Bâr Húrin.\n\nYou should speak with Anborn and Thurindol.

'Greetings, adventurer. Have you come to hunt wild game in Emyn Arnen?'

You ask Duilin about Anborn.

'If you're looking for Anborn, he's at the keep. He seems awfully busy though. He doesn't even have the time to hunt with us! Isn't that right, Derufin?'
'Stranger, you are bold to come and ask me where my leader is. You should not even be in these lands. But you speak Gladhir's name, so I will allow you here for now. It will take more
